title: JP Morgan Affiliates to Pay $151 Million to Resolve SEC Charges
J.P. Morgan Fined $3M for Misreporting 77 Billion Shares - Yahoo Finance
JPMorgan To Pay Investors $151M, SEC Flags 'Law Violations' - Benzinga
J.P. Morgan to Pay $150M to Settle Slew of SEC Charges - Wealth Management
CFTC Orders J.P. Morgan to Pay $200m for Supervision Errors
news: The Securities and Exchange Commission today charged J.P. Morgan Securities LLC and J.P. Morgan Investment Management Inc. in five separate enforcement actions for various failures, including misleading disclosures to investors and breach of fiduciary duty.
The Financial Industry Regulatory Authority (FINRA) fined J.P. Morgan Securities $3 million for inaccuracies in systemwide reporting.
The SEC has charged J.P. Morgan Securities and J.P. Morgan Investment Management, leading to an agreement to pay more than $151 million.
J.P. Morgan will pay over $150 million to settle multiple SEC charges, highlighting significant regulatory issues.
The Commodity Futures Trading Commission has charged J.P. Morgan Securities for failing to diligently supervise its business, resulting in oversight failures.
